# Strawberry Rhizosphere Community Composition X Abiotic Stress

A followup to Lazcano, Boyd, et. al 2021:

-   Investigate *mechanism* and *plasticity* of beneficial plant-microbe intrxns
    re: abiotic stress
-   Account for:
    -   geno x env effects (cultivar x soil, control other growing conditions)

## Field Trial

Use the same list of cultivars in Lazcano Boyd et al '21 for consistency's sake
(unless a better cross section of comm. üçì cultivars re: abiotic stress
resistance can be determined). Trial overview:

-   20 plants per plot, 0.3m raised beds
-   
-   Treatment:
    -   field soil\* with various\*\* macronutrient and drought stress factor
        levels
-   Control:
    -   field soil\*, standardized watering and fertilizer regimen

Field soil measured by soil classification, texture, slope, conductivity, pH,
cation exchange capacity, and percent organic matter. Additionally, levels of
the specific, tested nutrient levels affected by the treatment groups will be
measured as follows:

-   Ca:Mg ratio
-   Water content (neutron moisture gauge)
-   NPK

## Measurements

-   Nutrition: Leaf nutrient content (Ca:Mg, NPK, Carbon) by 300mg dry weight
    sample
    -   Duplicate samples
    -   Measure against tomato leaf standards NIST SRM 1573A ev. 10 samples
    -   N, C with element analyzer
    -   rest with mod. USEPA acid digestion
-   Yield: Total FW, DW biomass
-   Cultivar
-   Soil microbiome community diversity and structure
    -   V4 region 16S rRNA or shotgun metagenomics (if feasible, check
        <https://doi.org/10.3389/fmicb.2022.828977>)
